original_text:
PERTINENT CONSULTATIONS :
1. Dr. **NAME[UUU] .
2. Dr. **NAME[TTT] .
The patient is an **AGE[in 80s]- year - old Caucasian male who was admitted from **INSTITUTION due to respiratory distress .
On presentation to the ER , the patient was noted to be having labored breathing .
He was started on BiPAP on account of his code status .
The patient also was started on antibiotics for a possible pneumonia .
A chest x-ray done revealed bilateral infiltrates .
He also had elevated WBCs with bands of 20 .
The patient was started on Avelox .
Today is his third day on Avelox .
He also at presentation had a rapid ventricular response of atrial flutter and was given IV Cardizem .
He is also to continue his daily dosing of p.o. Cardizem .
The patient was not started on Coumadin on account of previous consults , considering that the patient had a recent fall with bleeding .
During the course of his CVU stay , he remained clinically stable , and his clinical improvement was sustained .
He was considered stable to be transferred to a regular floor .
The patient is also back in a normal sinus rhythm on 90 mg q.i.d. of Cardizem .
Today is his third day on Avelox .
The plan is to have Avelox for the next five to seven days .
Also , steroids are presently being tapered off , and this is to be done over the next three days .
Overall clinical improvement has been sustained for transfer .
______________________________
**NAME[WWW VVV XXX] , M.D.
HS Job # 130393 / 35282 /
# **ID-NUM
D :
**DATE[Nov 29 2007] 13:28
T :
**DATE[Nov 30 2007] 08:13
